00023 #ifndef __MT_BASIC_THREAD_POOL_H__
00024 #define __MT_BASIC_THREAD_POOL_H__
00025 
00026 #include <vector>
00027 #include "except/Exception.h"
00028 #include "sys/Mutex.h"
00029 #include "sys/Thread.h"
00030 #include "mt/RequestQueue.h"
00031 #include "mt/GenericRequestHandler.h"
00032 #include "mt/ThreadPoolException.h"
00033 
00034 namespace mt
00035 {
00036 template<typename RequestHandler_T>
00037 class BasicThreadPool
00038 {
00039 public:
00040 
00044     BasicThreadPool(unsigned short numThreads = 0) :
00045         mStarted(false)
00046     {
00047         mNumThreads = numThreads;
00048     }
00049 
00051     virtual ~BasicThreadPool()
00052     {
00053         destroy(mPool.size());
00054     }
00055 
00056     virtual void start()
00057     {
00058         if (mStarted)
00059             throw(ThreadPoolException("The thread pool is already started."));
00060 
00061         mStarted = true;
00062 
00063         for (unsigned short i = 0; i < mNumThreads; i++)
00064         {
00065             sys::Thread *thread = new sys::Thread(newRequestHandler());
00066             mPool.push_back(thread);
00067             mPool[i]->start();
00068         }
00069     }
00070 
00071     virtual void join()
00072     {
00073         for (unsigned short i = 0; i < mPool.size(); i++)
00074         {
00075             dbg_printf("mPool[%d]->join()\n", i);
00076             mPool[i]->join();
00077         }
00078         destroy(mPool.size());
00079         mStarted = false;
00080     }
00081 
00082     virtual void grow(unsigned short bySize)
00083     {
00084         mNumThreads += bySize;
00085     }
00086 
00087     virtual void shrink(unsigned short bySize)
00088     {
00089         if (mStarted)
00090             join();
00091 
00092         mNumThreads = (bySize > mNumThreads) ? 0 : mNumThreads - bySize;
00093     }
00094 
00095     void addRequest(sys::Runnable *handler)
00096     {
00097         mHandlerQueue.enqueue(handler);
00098     }
00099 
00100     virtual size_t getSize() const
00101     {
00102         return mPool.size();
00103     }
00104 
00105     virtual void shutdown()
00106     {
00107         // Add requests that signal the thread should stop
00108         static sys::Runnable *stopSignal = NULL;
00109         for (unsigned int i = 0, size = mPool.size(); i < size; ++i)
00110         {
00111             addRequest(stopSignal);
00112         }
00113         // Join all threads
00114         join();
00115         // Clear the request queue - mainly just cleanup in case we reuse
00116         mHandlerQueue.clear();
00117     }
00118 
00119 protected:
00120 
00121     // Derive this to use a new kind of request handler
00122     // For instance, you may want an IterativeRequestHandler
00123     virtual RequestHandler_T *newRequestHandler()
00124     {
00125         return new RequestHandler_T(&mHandlerQueue);
00126     }
00127 
00128     virtual void destroy(unsigned short bySize)
00129     {
00130         if (bySize > mPool.size())
00131             bySize = mPool.size();
00132 
00133         for (unsigned short i = 0; i < bySize; i++)
00134         {
00135             sys::Thread *t = mPool.back();
00136             mPool.pop_back();
00137             delete t;
00138         }
00139     }
00140 
00141     bool mStarted;
00142     unsigned short mNumThreads;
00143     std::vector<sys::Thread *> mPool;
00144     mt::RunnableRequestQueue mHandlerQueue;
00145 };
00146 }
00147 
00148 #endif
